title: Gross domestic product ( GDP ) growth rate in Brazil 2024
yAxis: GDP growth compared to previous year
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing GDP growth compared to previous year, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 7 significant trends.
The longest trend is moderately negative which exists from 2017 to 2014.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2021 to 2019.
Also, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2024 to 2023.
But, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2023 to 2022.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2022 to 2021.
Differently, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2019 to 2018.
But, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2018 to 2017.
gold: The statistic shows the growth in real GDP in Brazil from between 2014 and 2018 , with projections up until 2024 . In 2018 , Brazil 's real gross domestic product increased by 1.11 percent compared to the previous year.Brazilian growth and civic unrest GDP is a reliable tool used to indicate the shape of a national economy . It is one of the most well-known and well-understood measurements of the state of a country .
